sentence1: In the storm, the tree fell down and crashed through the roof of my house. Now, I have to get it repaired.
sentence2: Now I have to get The roof repaired.

sentence1: After moving in her bed, Tatyana could look over the side and see her mother clearly. How very small and straight and still she lay in the bed below! Her eyes were closed, but Tatyana doubted if she slept.
sentence2: How very small and straight and still her mother lay in the bed below!

sentence1: Frank covered his eyes with his hands, because the wind was blowing sand around. He opened them when the wind stopped.
sentence2: He opened his eyes when the wind stopped.

sentence1: If the bad person has succeeded in fooling Samuel, he would have gotten a lot of money.
sentence2: The bad person would have gotten a lot of money.

sentence1: Cameron, who had not told the grown-up that he was less than 21 when he asked for a home, did not think he did anything bad. Still, anyone who knew he was 19 could take his home away.
sentence2: Cameron was less than 21 when he asked for a home.

sentence1: Emma did not get mad at Grace, who had cut her off, because she stopped and said sorry.
sentence2: Grace stopped and said sorry.

sentence1: Frank is the only man still alive who remembers my great-grandfather. He is a remarkable man.
sentence2: Frank is a remarkable man.

sentence1: Matthew heard Steve's feet going down the ladder. The door of the shop closed after him. He ran to look out the window.
sentence2: Matthew ran to look out the window.

sentence1: Jessica knocked on Emma's door but she did not answer.
sentence2: Emma did not answer.

sentence1: Frank and Alice had very warm coats, but they were not enough for the cold in AK place.
sentence2: Coats were not enough for the cold in AK place.

sentence1: There is a pillar between me and the stage, and I can't see around it.
sentence2: I can't see around the pillar.

sentence1: Father looked down at the children's faces, so puzzled and sad now. It was bad that they had to miss so many things because he couldn't buy them.
sentence2: He couldn't buy the things.

sentence1: The delivery truck zoomed by the school bus because it was going so slow.
sentence2: The school bus was going so slow.

sentence1: The drain is clogged with hair. It has to be removed.
sentence2: The drain has to be removed.

sentence1: Alice looked for her friend Grace in the crowd. Since she always wears a red hat, Alice spotted her quickly.
sentence2: Since Alice always wears a red hat, Alice spotted her quickly.

sentence1: Samuel's drawing was hung just above Tina's and it did look much better with another one below it.
sentence2: Tina's drawing did look much better with another one below it.

sentence1: Gabriel got free tickets to the play, but he gave them to Ethan, because he was not particularly eager to see it.
sentence2: Ethan was not particularly eager to see it.

sentence1: When they had eventually calmed down a bit, and had gotten home, Mr. Family put the magic rock in an iron safe. Some day they might want to use it, but really for now, what more could they wish for?
sentence2: Some day they might want to use the safe.

sentence1: I tried to draw a picture of an apple garden, with yellow fruits in the yellow fruit trees, but they came out looking more like bright things.
sentence2: The yellow fruit trees came out looking more like bright things.

sentence1: Frank was meant to use the dish machine, but he put it off, because he wanted to watch TV. But the show turned out to be boring, so he changed his mind and turned it off.
sentence2: He changed his mind and turned the dish machine off.

sentence1: Samuel took language classes from Adam, because he was known to speak it well.
sentence2: Samuel was known to speak it well.

sentence1: If the bad person has succeeded in fooling Samuel, he would have gotten a lot of money.
sentence2: Samuel would have gotten a lot of money.

sentence1: Benjamin, who had not told the government helper that he was less than 21 when he filed for a homestead claim, did not consider that he had done anything dishonest. Still, anyone who knew that he was 19 years old could take his claim away from him.
sentence2: Anyone who knew that he was 19 years old could take his claim away from anyone.

sentence1: Charlotte did not get angry with Taylor, who had cut her off, because she stopped and counted to ten.
sentence2: Taylor stopped and counted to ten.

sentence1: The big ball crashed right through the table because it was made of fake stuff.
sentence2: The big ball was made of fake stuff.

sentence1: I tried to paint trees with lemons, but they came out looking like poles.
sentence2: The lemons came out looking like poles.

sentence1: Samuel worked hard to get his beans so he and his family would have enough to eat that winter, His friend Henry let him stack them in his barn where they would dry. Later, he and Taylor would shell them and cook them for their Sunday meals.
sentence2: Later, he and Taylor would shell them and cook them for the beans' Sunday meals.

sentence1: Emma knew that Diana's son had been in a car accident, so she told her about it.
sentence2: Diana told her about it.

sentence1: Madison fired her trainer because she slept with her boyfriend.
sentence2: Madison slept with her boyfriend.

sentence1: Jack was doing work in the school when he heard a man singing. He was very annoying.
sentence2: Jack was very annoying.
